page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: { Wenlock priory.}Monastic site pre dates town. Nunnery AD690;first abbess Milburga,royal house of Mercia. Little known of pre Conquest history. Roger of Montgomery,William the Conqueror's cousin & Regent in Normandy during 1066 invasion,given extensive land in Shropshire,including Wenlock:Earl of Shrewsbury. Built Shrewsbury Abbey. Refounded Wenlock as Cluniac priory. 1101 during rebuilding St. Milburga's bones found.Shrine built.Biography written.Miracles reported.Pilgramages encouraged. Mid 12th. century settlement developed on Priory land eg inn,smithy etc. partly for pilgrim trade. Town paid taxes to Priory till bought Charter 1342. Priory dissolved in Reformation 1540. Now picturesque ruins,though Prior's house (built 1500) is private house.
